title: Your main just started playing D&D
body:
What kind of character do they play, what kind of campaign are the playing, who are they playing with, and who's the GM?

Be creative!

{{champion:254}} plays an inspector-ish warlock skilled in swordsmanship, poking fun at Caitlyn's more proper manner (as opposed to her... "punch first" approach). Sherlock instead of Watson, ya know? There's an evil guy, and as far as Vi's concerned she just needs to be pointed in the right direction... while driving Caitlyn and Jayce insane along the way.

Obviously Ekko is the GM, always rewinding time to prevent TPK's. Playing would be way too easy.

replies.body: {{champion:41}} Plays a rouge, steals everything in sight, then runs off to the next town
How often does Gangplank have internal fights with the GM because eating a random fruit does not suddenly make him 'k'?
All the time

{{champion:17}} Plays as the unexpected hero, the Burglar, oh wait that's already a story....

*_rewrites_*

{{champion:103}} Plays  as the seductress, that steals the souls of men and/or turns them into pigs....nvm....

*_erases_*

{{champion:7}} Plays as if she's on the side of the hero, but betrays the hero, in a way so emotional distraught for the hero that he can't return to the quest the same anymore, and takes all the power and glory and gold. Don't forget the gold.{{item:3301}} Before the betrayal she becomes the best friend and ally to everyone on the quest, stealing little things here and there along the way, the team thinks she's the best ally ever. until she reveals she's the one they should've been after the entire time. She lures the good guys into a trap of her making, making them stray from the correct paths, fools them into doing mundane quests that get them almost nothing, then continues to thwart them as they try to figure out who's causing all the mayhem until she reveals herself as the true villain, and laughs at their pathetic attempts to outwit her on the entire journey, but chuckles every-time they fail, since this is all her doing as she is the DM. MUAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA.

_*pats self on the back* There we go. Much better._

{{champion:37}} plays as the stereotypical healer, but with a bonus, she's the unknown princess chosen by DM {{champion:201}}, as they continue on with there adventures to the Mystical Poro Kingdom. {{summoner:30}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}} {{summoner:31}} POROS!!!!
You're the kind of person I would want to play D&D with.
Truth be told, I've never actually played D&D myself. But I'm always a fan of stories.
{{champion:102}} would quit playing once she found that she couldn't play dragons and that she could only kill them.

> [{quoted}](name=Embertine,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=8dIYhzm8,comment-id=0016,timestamp=2015-09-10T13:36:06.616+0000)
>
> {{champion:102}} would quit playing once she found that she couldn't play dragons and that she could only kill them.

{{champion:59}} "It's just a game Shyvana, you don't need to flip the table.  Just play something else!"
{{champion:102}} "No dragon, no game."
{{champion:133}} "But it's fantasy.  Come on, sit back down, it's fun to be something else for a time!"
{{champion:102}} "Yeah, because fantasy is the only place anyone wants a ranger with a hand crossbow and an eagle companion."
{{champion:133}} "Eh, heh heh..."  *Looks down at the floor sadly.  Sniffles.*  "We'll be popular someday, Val..."
{{champion:10}} *Hands Shyvana a character sheet without a word.*
{{champion:102}} "The hell do you...  Hm...  Half-dragon brutal pugilist?  So, I play a character who flies into a murderous rage and destroys people with their bare hands?  **This is in the game?**"  *Stands the table back up.*  "Alright.  Let's play."
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/676/238/dfe.gif
Dragonborn tho
Uhhh my mains the Dark Lord Mordekaiser he's the villian in most campaigns.
What kind of Dark Lord, the Sauron kind or the Voldemort kind?
Dude sauron. This isn't DarkSun. (Reference separates the d&d players from the old school D&D players)

> [{quoted}](name=Mordepool,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=8dIYhzm8,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-09-10T00:00:02.007+0000)
>
> Dude sauron. This isn't DarkSun. (Reference separates the d&d players from the old school D&D players)

I haven't ever played a single session of any version of DnD and I am thoroughly familiar with Dark Sun.

Of course, I have been reading the Order of the Stick Forums since the comic began 10 years ago :D

{{champion:10}} plays with the Demacian crowd.  Tired of being stereotyped as 'the Lawful Good paladin' (which she played in the last three adventures) she's decided to make her new character a tyrannical Lawful Evil cleric with dreams of taking over the world, explaining to the surprised group that she'd like to 'play myself as Morgana sees me.'  A shameless powerbuilder who seems able to do everything, the other Demacians' goodly PCs are willing to put up with her character because she's the only one enabling them to survive the repeated dragon attacks sent by novice DM Shyvana.

{{champion:421}}
Plays a bard with a CHA of 18, a maxed Diplomacy skill, and ridiculously lucky rolls so she manages to talk her way out of everything despite the fact that the rest of the party, except for their fighter ({{champion:37}}), has no idea what she's saying.

{{champion:48}} He signs up as "Lawful good wood elf" and uses a bow that shoots bananas

He wins the game from the outset because he is so troll that nobody suspects the banana.

{{champion:133}} Ranger: That one ranged character that decides, "You know what, FUCK THIS!! I'M THE FRONTLINE NOW!!" and proceeds to go with her bird and manage to scrape out  a few kills before dieing. RIP Quinn, 2013, Doomed since release.
You should talk to the Rivens, Tryndameres, and Darius players that I've fought against in top lane with Quinn. Last I've heard of them, they still can't sit down yet.
Oh yeah, I know... Huehuehue. Many a player has fed horribly against my top Quinn... Or my ADC Quinn... Or my mid Quinn... Or my Jg Quinn... I play a lot of Quinn.

You should write a guide for Quinn.  I can see top,bot, jung Quinn, cant see her mid though.

From:Another Quinn player

She actually works very well mid. Her ult gives a ton of burst damage making her very good at killing a target efficiently. Her ult also gives her some great roaming power. Here is what I usually build on her when I go mid. {{item:3134}} /{{item:3155}}  depending on the matchup. (Hexdrinker for people like Leblanc, Fizz, Ahri, brutalizer against most other match ups) into {{item:3072}} for sustain and some great damage into {{item:3087}} for some wave clear and some extra burst. Then I finish off {{item:3142}} and the rest is situational. QSS if they have a lot of cc, IE for more damage, armor pen items ( Quinn doesn't have the best damage) or maybe a GA or Banshees veil. Don't forget to throw in some boots (or a Zephyr if you're like me). I usually get Berserkers Greaves or Merc Treads.
I'll make sure to try this. Add me on League?
Sure. I can't right now (on phone) but if you add me or make a reply to this, I should be able to remember.

{{champion:119}} joins the party as a ranger, but literally walks to the front line, next to the fighter and paladin, so he can show off. He is very skilled, but due to his arrogance he often tries to get into the middle of the enemy (even though everyone constantly reminds him he didn't go dual-wielding blade ranger, he went ranged ranger, so he should STAY BACK). Constantly gets the crap beaten out of him, to the point where the cleric {{champion:16}} literally just follows him around and heals him, so he doesn't die. He then proceeds to complain to the GM how the enemies are too weak and should be made stronger to suit his "amazing skills". Oh, and he always insists that he is the best in the group and should be getting paid the most for all these missions (the GM is {{champion:27}}, and he doesn't really care, so he just kinda says, "yeah, that's great, see me afterwards" and then rushes out of there the moment the group decides to wrap up the game) By the way, here's what the party looks like:

{{champion:86}} Paladin
{{champion:2}} Barbarian
{{champion:76}} Druid
{{champion:13}} Wizard/Warlock
{{champion:119}} Ranger

{{champion:82}} plays a knight trained to use a tower shield, not exactly pleased with the lack of ability to manipulate metal specifically, combined with the convoluted difficulty in trying to play a necromancer (why can't he just control a dead enemy whenever he wants like he always does). He plans on getting more into the game to homebrew things, so he has to do less roleplaying, and grumbles whenever Vi's warlock pokes his knight with her sword.
You only have to poke once, fool...
{{champion:245}} is the GM. Chaos ensues.
Veigar would make such a good DM.

{{champion:17}} "Can I play Lawful Evil?  PLEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEASE?"  *gives DM the puppy dogs eyes and the lip*
{{champion:37}} "Yes...I'm playing Bard again.  Deal."
{{champion:21}} "Look...the Gunslinger rules are right there and there are no rules saying I can't be a Dread Pirate prestige class from it!"
{{champion:2}} "Could someone please tell Tryndamere we can't have two Barbarians in the party?"
{{champion:23}} "I AM THE KING OF THE FRELJORD I WILL BE A BARBARIAN AND THERE'S NOTHING YOU CAN DO TO STOP ME YOU WINTER'S CLAW MEATBAG!"

*snerk*  That was awesome, Krazee.  That gave me quite the chuckle!  Anyways, some more...

{{champion:122}} What do you mean I can't take Great Cleave at level 1?!?
{{champion:120}} Ugh...trying to make an undead centaur character is harder than I thought.  I have to have WHAT penalties?!?
{{champion:53}} *monotone* WHERE...ARE...THE...WARFORGED...RULES?
{{champion:45}} No...I'm not trying to play as Vivi in D&D.  Why do people keep asking me that?
{{champion:11}} plays a half-elf fighter and is very strategic at things and doesnt go in alone when it seems he will lose, he travels with {{champion:62}} a monk

{{champion:80}} is playing a Fighter/rogue multiclass charged with bodyguarding the paladin {{champion:89}} by the Solari and Rakkor.  Not that she needs it as every encounter proves.  They are followed by {{champion:131}}, a Rogue/cleric who is obsessed with ending the Solari reign but finds herself helping the duo from the shadows, excusing herself with the belief that it must be her that defeats the suns messiah.

After coming across a Noxian encampment, they are joined by the barbarian {{champion:12}}.  At first {{champion:80}} distrusted the Minotaur, but his battle prowess has done enough to prove himself.  

Diana soon gains a follower of the most unexpected degree.  {{champion:267}} the sorceress, a determined mermaid on pilgrimage to save her people.  {{champion:267}} believes that {{champion:131}} is the key to saving her people, but the zealot's obsession with {{champion:89}} keeps her too preoccupied to dare stray.  Thus {{champion:267}} has vowed to help the chosen of the moon in her confusing goal.

They're destination is the lost empire of Shurima to retrieve an ancient artifact of relation to the sun.  4 guardians are said to stand guard of this artifact, ever vigilant like statues.  

{{champion:75}} The Scholar 
{{champion:58}} The Marauder
{{champion:101}} The Bound 
And
{{champion:268}}  The Conqueror

Unknowingly they are hunted by infamous {{champion:35}}, hired by Noxus to track and kill the group before retrieving the artifact.

The DM?  {{champion:44}} 

{{champion:44}}: Get ready for th-
{{champion:12}}: is it another Gem creature?
{{champion:44}} _looks at the sheet of_ {{champion:72}} 
{{champion:44}}:...maybe.
_Group sighs._

{{champion:44}}: also he has a mate
Group: Is it something to do with the void
{{champion:44}}: Looks at the sheet for {{champion:421}}.
{{champion:44}}: Maybe...
{{champion:68}}: "Why is this table so tall?! I can't see the board!"
{{champion:101}}  HMMMMM the magus ascendant... MAKE HIM A WARRIOR

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=8dIYhzm8,comment-id=,timestamp=2015-09-09T22:55:40.417+0000)

Sherlock instead of Watson, ya know? There's an evil guy, and as far as Vi's concerned she just needs to be pointed in the right direction... while driving Caitlyn and Jayce insane along the way.
> 
> Obviously Ekko is the GM, always rewinding time to prevent TPK's. Playing would be way too easy.

{{champion:37}} Um...How would she play? Sign language? Icrieeritim ;-;

Telepathy, perhaps?

Maybe she plays with Ahri and Ahri speaks for her.
Morse.  Code.

> [{quoted}](name=HVGHighVelocity,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=8dIYhzm8,comment-id=001d,timestamp=2015-09-10T18:50:39.061+0000)
>
> {{champion:37}} Um...How would she play? Sign language? Icrieeritim ;-;

My girlfriend is mute, and that's exactly how she does D&D. Sadly, she needs an interpreter when she does play because not everyone can understand sign language.

Veigar as a druid, so he can become bigger creatures like bears and so on u.u

Or even DRAGONS

> [{quoted}](name=Decrit,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=8dIYhzm8,comment-id=0024,timestamp=2015-09-12T17:58:55.268+0000)
>
> Veigar as a druid, so he can become bigger creatures like bears and so on u.u
> 
> Or even DRAGONS

Uhhh.......... No. Druids cannot Wildshape into dragons. 

Well, not normally. You need to be a lvl 10 Druid and the feat from the 3.5 _Draconomicon_. It scales very slowly, but it's rewarding at later levels.

well yeah, i was talking about that.

my bad, should have kept it easy :P there is also ded 5 to take into account.

{{champion:99}} plays a big, strapping knight ala: {{champion:86}} and spends the entire game mocking him mercilessly.
